result.execSummary:
All charges against Virinder Singh Brar in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Virinder Singh Brar is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Virinder Singh Brar

defendant.name: Brar, Virinder Singh
defendant.address: 1201 West College Avenue, Oak Creek, WI 53154

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Virinder Singh Brar in court with Attorney Colin Patrick McGinn.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is not present. Defense moves to dismiss. Court ordered case dismissed without prejudice.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Attorney Colin Patrick McGinn in court, defendant Virinder Singh Brar not in court, in custody, appearance waived.  Dennis Patrick Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense filed bail motion. Court orders $1,000 signature bond with Justice point supervision Level 5. Case remains calendared in prelim court. Case is adjourned.
Defense counsel contacted the court requesting a bail review.  The parties agree via email of the new court date. 7/6/22 at 1:30pm
Defendant's Motion To Modify Bond - received

Defendant Virinder Singh Brar not in court, defendant in custody. Gregg Herman appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing at 8:30am. Case called at 4:50pm. Due to Court congestion Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed, Public Defender Order Appointing Counsel

Defendant Virinder Singh Brar not in court, defendant in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. Attorney Colin McGinn to be appointed pending conflict check. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Virinder Singh Brar not in court, defendant in custody.  Annie Louk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is not present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Virinder Singh Brar not in court, defendant in custody.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no contact with DMF.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.
  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Virinder Singh Brar in court with attorney Rosemary Cuevas.  Defendant Virinder Singh Brar in custody.  Sara Waldschmidt-DeSmet appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Sanders, Branch 28. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 4, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
